subject: RE: [junit] Testing dynamically generating filepath and filename
msgSnippet: First tip: keep the generation of the filenames separate from the usage of the filename. That way you can effectively test that you are generating appropriate
messageBody:
First tip: keep the generation of the filenames separate from the usage of the filename. That way you can effectively test that you are generating appropriate filenames for any given input data.

Next, create temp files (actually fairly easy in Java) and read or write them through your file access code and then check that you read or wrote what you expected to.

Hope this helps.

Simon

>-----Original Message-----
>From: barath amarnath [mailto:barzenith@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 2004 12:53 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] Testing dynamically generating filepath and filename
>
>
>Hi All,
>Our system having module named Doc Management. In this
>module, the one class is generating filepath and
>filename as per STRING pattern
>(such as
>c:\temp\[date]\[time]\dynamicallygeneratedfilename
>c:\temp\[date][time]\randomnumber\dynamicallygeneratedfilename
>
>I am in the process of writing test cases for the
>above dynamically generated file path and name.
>
>If any of you give some tips or ideas how to test this
>functionality, it will be very useful to me.
>
>Thanks & Regards,
>K.Barath.
>
>
